title: is saying "gg ez" being toxic?
body: I got reported for harassment for saying "gg ez" at the end of  a game. I said that cuz they were wining and liss was spamming laugh all game taunting us and when we won i wanted to pay her back so i said that and i got reported... sigh i already got banned i haven't been toxic in games anymore but i don't wanna get banned for life just because i said that...

replies.body:
Hey Godric Lockhart,

As others have mentioned, saying things along the lines of "GG EZ" are considered unsportsmanlike conduct. This falls under "Show Humility in Victory, and Grace in Defeat" in the [Summoner's Code](http://gameinfo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/get-started/summoners-code/).

If you don't have anything nice to say, it's best to not say anything at all. On the flip side, if someone is doing well, it's always nice to encourage your team, or even say things like 'well played' to an opponent. 

**TL;DR** - It's not cool to say things like "GG EZ".
Is negative attitude the correct report option? I feel like it doesn't quite justify a harassment or verbal abuse report

Use your best judgment on a case by case basis. Sometimes, other things are said in addition, which may fall better under harassment/verbal abuse. For something like this alone, I would use negative attitude.

Last I heard 'gg easy' fell under Verbal abuse.

But that was a while back, doesn't make it appropriate either way.

Is this an automatic thing? Because I always thought it was suitable as a friendly joke when the opposing team has an Ezreal (or, at least, I've always taken it as a friendly joke when I've been Ezreal)
Unless you've been making jokes about it all game, I wouldn't count on your opponents interpreting it that way.

That brings up an interesting question. Where is the line drawn? Is spamming laugh when you're stomping your lane unsportsmanlike? Can you get reported for it? What about the taunt animation? Obviously that's not disallowed since it was put in the game, but what if you spam it?

I'm just curious, I'm not condoning rude behavior, (I actually keep all chat off personally).
Unless you're {{champion:44}}
*facepalm* I'm losing hope in rito if 'gg ez lemon sqeezy rekteroni n cheezy' is bannable...... you guys really like being a boner killer to trash talkers.
"gg ez" pretty much translates as "good game, you guys sucked like hell!", and this is still considered unsportsmanship.
Yes.  It has been said by Riot.  Also, someone else being a duck doesn't mean you need to be a duck too.
Quack
I usually just say "whose laughing now" if they laugh the whole game.
If you are playing {{champion:27}} you spam laugh all game to get people to chase you.
And now, he laughs when he use his fling too!

When someone spams emotes to sound like a douche, I will occasionally make myself sound douchey as well. But when I lose a game that was fun or otherwise an honorale loss, only for some butthead to say "gg ez" and make me upset about the loss. I consider it toxic when unprovoked.

Not at all.

People love to be told that they aren't trying they're best.

Yes, yes it is very toxic.

Why? Because by saying "GG EASY", you're basically saying "You were a worthless waste of my time, you shitty fucking player". And considering your opponent is probably already feeling shitty over losing, he really doesn't need some smartass saying that all his efforts were meaningless.

I generally make sure to report for that, so yeah. Violates the summoner's code. 

If you lose, on the other hand, it's okay to say 'gg ez'. Especially if there's an ezreal on the other team :V
Yes it is, it's like slapping your opponents in the face with salt right after you gave them a few cuts.

Yes, I'd say so. Don't get me wrong, there are worse offenses. But imagine you're on the other team and you were trying really hard to win, and here you are saying "Good game, but you were garbage I didn't even have to try"

That's not very nice.

On the flip side if you say that when you lose, it's just funny.
Pretty Much

Words are never toxic, only the context and the attitude behind them can be.

"gg ez" can function both as a jest and a taunt/provocation, it depends.
yeah basically - provoking in a way.
I believe that Riot's reporting AI auto reports people who say "GG EZ" at or near the end of the game, regardless if someone reports them or not now.
Unless you're {{champion:44}} ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

Anything that can remotely under any circumstance make someone mad in this game is considered toxic. Although saying that isn't truly toxic in any way, sensitive players will report you for it and you will be banned.
